safety_precautions: Always wear safety glasses and gloves while working
Work in a well ventilated area when using wood glue or paint
Make sure the chair is stable before starting the repair

steps.description: Clean the cracked area thoroughly to remove any dust or debris.
Apply wood glue into the crack and press the two parts together. Wipe away any excess glue that seeps out.
Place clamps on the glued area, and let it dry according to the glue manufacturer's instructions.
Once the glue is dry, remove the clamps. If there are still visible cracks, fill them with wood filler and let it dry.
Sand the repaired area until it's smooth and even with the rest of the chair back.
Optional: If you wish, you can paint or stain the repaired area to match the rest of the chair.

tips: For best results, ensure the wood glue is applied evenly and in sufficient quantity
Make sure the clamps are not overtightened as it could cause more damage
When painting or staining, always go with the grain of the wood
